Bug Description:

Bug ID: 2
Project: Codec
Bug Type: SL SH SF

1. Summary:
The codec fails when it expects an EOF signal but receives an integer instead.

2. Description:
The bug is found in the 'encode' method of the codec project. When the end of file (EOF) is detected (inAvail < 0), the program switches based on the modulus, encoding remaining data and adding padding as necessary. 

Afterwards, if 'lineLength' is greater than 0, it attempts to add a line separator. However, the 'lineLength > 0' condition doesn't verify that there is valid data in the buffer (indicated by 'pos > 0'), leading to a situation where the buffer may not have sufficient space for a line separator, resulting in an assertion error as the test expects an End of File signal but receives an integer value instead.

3. Steps to Reproduce:
This error can be reproduced through the following steps:
   a. Initialize the 'encode' method with input byte array 'in' where the size 'inAvail' < 0 (indicating EOF)
   b. Initialize 'lineLength' > 0 but 'pos' == 0
   c. Run the 'encode' function and it will cause junit.framework.AssertionFailedError: EOF expected:<-1> but was:<13> 

4. Expected Behavior:
The program should allow for line separation only if there is space remaining in the buffer. It should only execute 'System.arraycopy(lineSeparator, 0, buf, pos, lineSeparator.length);' if 'lineLength' > 0 and also 'pos' > 0 indicating there is valid data in the buffer.

5. Actual Behavior:
The program attempts line separation even when 'pos' == 0, in scenarios where 'lineLength' > 0, causing an assertion error.

6. Diagnosis and Fixing:
The issue lies within the 'if' condition checking for 'lineLength' > 0. To fix this bug, the 'if' condition should be modified to check both if 'lineLength' > 0 and 'pos' > 0. 

7. Fixed Code:
The 'if' condition is modified as
if (lineLength > 0 && pos > 0) {
                System.arraycopy(lineSeparator, 0, buf, pos, lineSeparator.length);
                pos += lineSeparator.length;
            }

This fix ensures that the program only attempts to add a line separator if there is valid data in the buffer.
